name: Guy's Thatched Hamlet

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for one night (31st May 2011) Paid 59 pounds for a room. Nice ambiance, good for a drink and a quiet stroll down the canal path. decent clean room/bathroom with the usual furnishings/toiletries/tea-making etc
reviews.title: Good accommodation.......Let down by Poor Food!

reviews.text: What let the place down for me was the poor 'restaurant food'. terribly over-priced for what you got, and more like canteen food, I ordered fish with prawns. It was overcooked and totally bland, it came with a side order of overcooked veg and tasteless boiled potatoes. My partner had the langoustines with rice, again fairly bland. What a disappointment!
reviews.title: Nice place, terrible food

reviews.text: 17 Pounds for a main with this level of quality is unacceptable, the restaurant needs to get its act together, or lower its prices.
reviews.title: Pleasantly different

reviews.text: I would stay again, but eat elsewhere
reviews.title: if i could clone this place and place it in blackpool then i would.

reviews.text: Stayed here in August 2010 for a joint birthday break.
reviews.title: Excellent - Well worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner booked a night at Guys as a birthday suprise and OMG what a suprise it was, certaily one I will never forget. We stayed in one of "PLUSH" rooms, far from plush and certainly not worth £85 a night. When we arrived and checked in my partner asked to confirm the time of the booking for the evening meal and they had us booked in an hour earlier than my partner had asked and sighed when we wanted it changing. We went for a drink which was good and the bar staff were very helpful. We went for the meal, ordered and our started was taken to another table and then waited for around 30mins for our main course. The food wasn't good enough for what they charged, I've had better meals at half the cost. We went back to the room and then the noise began and carried on till 4:30am. We did complain to the manager at around 1:30am and asked if we could be moved to another room. The manager did speak to the couple in the next room and there was silence for all of 30 seconds. We could hear everything the couple were doing and saying and I mean EVERTHYING. If we hadn't had a drink I would of left. Breakfast, well I wish I hadn't bothered, total waste of more money. In total we spent around £200 and my advice to others would be, go spend you hard earned money else where.
reviews.title: OMG NEVER EVER AGAIN - AVOID IF YOU LIKE AT LEAST 1HRS SLEEP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a birthday suprise for my partners birthday,have been to guys many times before to eat and to stay!!! but this will be our last time to vist this place think i would have got more sleep on the fast lane of the m6 in rush hour!!! The walls are paper thin you can hear every switch been switched off,you dont have to have the volume on your tv just turn it on the same program as next door.I made a complaint at 1.30am at the noise of next door to the manger,he did come out to speak to the people next door to us but this continued until 4.30am if i had not had a drink i would have gone home.Next morning i checked out of the hotel was never asked how our stay was had to ask to make a complaint but the member staff didnt seem that bothered we emailed the next day with our over night problems but even that member staff could not cared.Guys have had our money not bothered about the level of service they offer.Think they should remember its the public who help pay there wages.
reviews.title: If you dont want to sleep and want to pay high costs then this is the place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were attending a weekend course at Myerscough and decided to stay over and this seemed a great location. As we were staying on a Friday evening we took full advantage of their 'Friday Feeling' offer which was a fab price of £80 per night, including £20 off an evening meal in the restaurant with ½ a bottle of red or white wine and full english breakfast. Having read the mixed reviews I wasn't expecting too much especially from the accommodation but how wrong were we! I arrived before my husband and was shown directions to my room by a very helpful receptionist. We were allocated room 27 which must be in a new/refurbished area of the complex as it was like new, a spotless, modern room - bathroom was spacious and absolutely spotless. We booked into the eating establishment that evening and after a quick drink at the bar our table was ready. The food was excellent, the wine was good, service was excellent - we had a great evening. Next morning we were up early and first in for breakfast, our papers which we had ordered the evening before were waiting for us when we arrived and we were quickly shown to a table. The breakfast is self service, with plenty of choice, everything was fresh and good quality. Unfortunately, we didn't get chance to fully explore all that Guys had to offer but we will definitely return for a further investigation!! We would highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Beyond Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have eaten at Old nell's a few times and eaten at Guys once or twice in the past, but as a supprise my wife booked an overnight stay at The Thatched, and a meal.
reviews.title: Wedding anniversary treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we got to our room, the first thing my wife said was it looked a lot bigger on the internet page, we saw the bottle of champagne that she had pre-ordered, in a plastic bag with some ice, but mostly water, I thought it tasted disgusting, but she said it was drinkable.
reviews.title: Chavsville and food is canteen-like and hugely over-priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a stay at Guy's Tatched Hamlet, where we stayed in the Executive Superior Room.
reviews.title: Executive Superior Room

reviews.text: The room is spacious, clean and very nice. The bathroom has a large jacuzzi bath, a walk in shower and a waterproof TV with surround sound system. The bathroom could do with a bit of attention as it is a bit run down but that did not stop us from enjoying our time there very much!.....A little bit of adivce, do not get too carried away with the bubble bath in the jacuzzi as it is a nightmare to rinse off as we found out for ourselves.....;).....
reviews.title: Toilets disgusting

reviews.text: Ample parking is provided free of charge. We had a few drinks at the Owd Nell's Tavern and a meal at the restaurant which we enjoyed very much.
reviews.title: a bit unclean however good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only bad point was having to wait what seems to have been a very long time to get a table at the restaurant, and one of the receptionist ( the older one) was not very friendly but apart from that we have had an amazing time and have already booked to return.....
reviews.title: accomodation left a lot to be desired

reviews.text: Having stayed here on numerous occasions with my partner we decided to stop off just for lunch with my children. I ordered drinks then went into the toilets as soon as I opened the door the smell nearly stopped me going any further, I complained to the bar/restaurant manageress who appologised and said she would check them over. I was put off ordering food but the rest of the party were hungry so we reluctantly orderded.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night, rooms needed updating - sink in bedroom as bathroom to small to fit it in, the spa bath needs replacing. Not so easy to find rooms as just given a map at reception with the number circled.
reviews.title: Could Do Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice location would be nice if the rooms were updated.
reviews.title: Excellent anniversary

reviews.text: Stayed here when renewed wedding vows. Good to see the rooms have all been refurbished. The food was excellent as we ate here after the church service. The staff and service was very good. Have been visiting guys for years but the friends who came down from Scotland with us it was there frist time and they have already booked to come back. I also want to thank the staff for making our second honeymoon wonderful.
reviews.title: BRILLIANT!

reviews.text: I have been going to guys for years now and never disappointing the rooms are gorgeous and spotless and the entertainment is great and relaxing too .. there is always something going on and the food is gorgeous! i pay 65.00 pounds for the room and get a free 20.00pounds voucher to be whatever food i want ... i am going again for Halloween where they have free entertainment on for the kids and have free treacle toffee for everyone and then at the end of the night they put the fireworks on .. cannot wait to go .. worth every last penny every time i have been !!! highly recommended !!
reviews.title: Great place to relax and fun

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in October the weather was unseasonably warm, which made the stay even better.
reviews.title: Little Gem

description: Imagine a canal-side hamlet of thatched roofed buildings and you're thinking Guy's Thatched Hamlet, just off the A6 at Bilsborrow near the market town of Garstang. You will find Guy's Eating Establishment and pizzeria nestling next to the atmospheric Owd Nell's Tavern, Guy's Lodge and School House Square. Guy's Restaurant & Pizzeria with its eyebrow window that is the largest in Europe always offers great hospitality with excellent local and international cuisine cooked in our kitchens and open pizzeria.Owd Nell's Tavern serves such traditional delights as home-made beef steak and kidney pudding, local game in season, chargrilled Aberdeen Angus Scottish steaks and fresh fish from Fleetwood. These are just a few meals from the extensive mouth-watering menu.Relax on our canalside patios were you can eat and drink whilst watching the canal barges and ducks, or on the tavern deck, our roof terrace drinking area.
